title: "Retirement In Your Hands, Playing For India Is Not": Rohit Sharma Served Big Warning - NDTV Sports
summary:
Retirement In Your Hands, Playing For India Is Not: Rohit Sharma Served Big Warning

Publication Date: January 5, 2025

Source: NDTV Sports

In a recent interview, Rohit Sharma discussed his cricketing future amid speculations of his retirement, clarifying that while retirement is a personal decision, his place in the team will ultimately be determined by the selectors.

  • Sanjay Manjrekar emphasizes that while players can decide on retirement, performance determines team selection.
  • Rohit has opted out of the latest Test match due to poor form and expresses that he won't retire soon.
  • Manjrekar notes the impact of selectors' choices on players' careers, highlighting a respect for hierarchy in the selection process.
“Retirement is in your hands, but playing for India is not,” Sanjay Manjrekar stated.

The conversation sheds light on the balancing act of personal ambitions versus team requirements in professional sports.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma's Future in Indian Cricket: A Candid Discussion

title: Sunil Gavaskar Unhappy He Wasn't Called To Hand Over BGT to Australia: 'Just Because I'm Indian…' - News18
India's Fixtures In 2025-2027 World Test Championship: Away Series In England, New Zealand; BGT At Home - News18
On Virat Kohli's Retirement Rumours, Pat Cummins' Statement Wins Internet - NDTV Sports
Sunil Gavaskar snubbed by Cricket Australia, legend has 'no clue why' - The Times of India
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar Snubbed by Cricket Australia, Legend Has 'No Clue Why'

Publication Date: Recent Source: Times of India

In a surprising turn of events, legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar expressed his confusion regarding his absence from the Border-Gavaskar Trophy presentation ceremony at the Sydney Cricket Ground. While Gavaskar was present at the venue for commentary, only Allan Border was on stage during the ceremony, prompting Gavaskar to comment, 'I don't know, ask Cricket Australia.'

  • Sunil Gavaskar was present at the venue but was not invited on stage during the presentation ceremony.
  • Cricket Australia acknowledged it would have been preferable for both Gavaskar and Border to have shared the stage.
  • Australia won the fifth Test against India, claiming the series 3-1 after a decade-long wait for the trophy.
  • Gavaskar completed his broadcast duties before leaving the venue, indicating scheduling was not an issue.
“I don't know, ask Cricket Australia.” - Sunil Gavaskar

This incident has raised questions regarding the decisions made by Cricket Australia, especially considering Gavaskar's legendary status in cricket.
newTitle: Sunil Gavaskar Snubbed at Border-Gavaskar Trophy Presentation

title: "You Could Be More Sensible": Gautam Gambhir Left Fuming At Reporter Over Rohit Sharma Question - NDTV Sports
summary:
Gautam Gambhir Critiques Media Coverage on Rohit Sharma During Press Conference

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

In a recent press conference, Gautam Gambhir expressed frustration at media portrayals of Rohit Sharma's decisions during the Test series against Australia, emphasizing team over individual interests.

  • Australia won the Sydney Test, concluding the series 3-1.
  • Rohit Sharma opted out of the last match, while Jasprit Bumrah was injured.
  • Gambhir criticized reports questioning Rohit's leadership and called for more sensible commentary.
  • He stated that players should prioritize team and country over personal interests.
  • He acknowledged the absence of Bumrah, stating the team shouldn't rely on one individual.
“...you could be more sensible about it. When a captain or leader takes a call, keeping the team in mind, I don't think there's anything bad.” - Gautam Gambhir

Gambhir’s comments highlight the ongoing pressures and scrutiny on team leaders in sports, emphasizing the importance of teamwork over individual performance.
newTitle: Gautam Gambhir Critiques Media Coverage on Rohit Sharma During Press Conference

title: India’s BGT report card: Confused selections, batsmen with starts who didn’t capitalise & stars in front of microphones who couldn’t walk the talk - The Indian Express
summary:
India’s BGT report card: Confused selections, batsmen with starts who didn’t capitalise & stars in front of microphones who couldn’t walk the talk

Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The Indian team faced significant challenges in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia, ultimately falling short despite some strong individual performances.

  • Jasprit Bumrah was the standout player, earning the 'Man of the Series' title but could not lead the team to victory in the final match.
  • India’s batting unit struggled, with key players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli failing to convert good starts into match-winning scores.
  • Confusion around player selections adversely impacted team performance, such as the inclusion of Harshit Rana and the batting order shuffle.
  • Pat Cummins and the Australian side celebrated their victory while maintaining focus on future prospects.
“Ultimately, it’s neither my team nor your team, it’s the nation’s team.” - Gautam Gambhir

India’s chaotic series resulted in a historical loss, raising questions about strategy, player roles, and the need for a cohesive approach moving forward.
newTitle: India’s BGT Report Card: Mixed Performances and Strategic Confusion

title: "You can't be that soft": Gautam Gambhir mocks Sam Konstas and Australia head coach Andrew McDonald - Crictoday
summary:
“You can’t be that soft”: Gautam Gambhir mocks Sam Konstas and Australia head coach Andrew McDonald

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: Crictoday

Gautam Gambhir, known for his assertive nature, defended the Indian cricket team against accusations of intimidation by the Australian coach following a heated exchange during a match.

  • Gambhir directly responded to Andrew McDonald’s criticisms regarding the behavior of Indian players towards Sam Konstas.
  • The incident occurred when Konstas provoked Jasprit Bumrah during a game.
  • Bumrah retaliated verbally, asserting that Konstas should not interfere, as it was the umpire’s role to manage such situations.
  • Gambhir emphasized that cricket is a tough sport and insisted that players should be tougher.
“It is a tough sport, played by tough men. You can’t be that soft.” – Gautam Gambhir

The comments highlight the competitive nature of cricket and the expectations of player conduct in high-pressure situations.
newTitle: Gautam Gambhir Responds to Andrew McDonald’s Softness Claims

title: 'He had no right, no business': Gautam Gambhir slams Sam Konstas on Jasprit Bumrah altercation - The Times of India
Rohit Sharma showed accountability at the top: Gautam Gambhir - The Times of India
summary:
Rohit Sharma showed accountability at the top: Gautam Gambhir

Date: Not provided Source: Times of India

In a recent press conference, India’s head coach Gautam Gambhir praised Rohit Sharma for prioritizing the team's needs over his personal batting form during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, which India lost 1-3 to Australia.

  • Rohit Sharma missed the first Test to be with his family for the birth of his second child.
  • He batted in the middle order for two Tests to maintain the opening partnership but struggled with scores of 3 and 6.
  • His return to the opening position in the fourth Test did not improve his score, adding just 11 runs.
  • Eventually, he rested for the final Test after a prolonged slump in form.
  • Gambhir emphasized Rohit’s accountability, stating, "To keep the dressing room happy, I have to be honest and fair to everyone."
  • The loss against Australia means India missed out on the World Test Championship final and ended a decade-long hold on the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
"Rohit Sharma showed accountability at the top," said Gautam Gambhir.

This series loss highlights the challenges the Indian cricket team is currently facing as they undergo a transitional phase.
newTitle: Gautam Gambhir Commends Rohit Sharma's Accountability in Tough Times

title: Sunil Gavaskar upset that he wasn’t called to hand over Border-Gavaskar Trophy to Australia - The Indian Express
India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 3: AUS claim BGT after a decade with 6-wicket win, IND out of WTC Final race - Hindustan Times
summary:
India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 3: AUS claim BGT after a decade with 6-wicket win, IND out of WTC Final race

Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a thrilling match, Australia claimed the Border-Gavaskar Trophy after defeating India by 6 wickets, clinching the series 3-1. This win marks a significant moment for Australia, who had not won the trophy in a decade.

  • Travis Head (34*) and Beau Webster (39*) led Australia to victory.
  • India's Jasprit Bumrah missed the match due to injury, impacting India's bowling lineup.
  • Australia scored 162 runs to win after India was bowled out for 157 in their second innings.
  • Scott Boland achieved a remarkable 10-wicket haul across both innings.
  • India is now out of contention for the World Test Championship Final.
“Unreal. Few of us didn't have. Lived up to all the hype...Immensely proud.” - Pat Cummins

Overall, Australia's strong performance throughout the series allowed them to regain the trophy, while India faced challenges due to injuries and missed opportunities.
newTitle: India vs Australia 5th Test Day 3: Australia Wins Border-Gavaskar Trophy

title: Australia regain Border-Gavaskar Trophy, set up WTC final date with SA - ESPNcricinfo

summary:
"Have To Be Fair": Gautam Gambhir's Blunt Take On Future Of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 • Source: NDTV

In a recent press conference, India head coach Gautam Gambhir addressed questions regarding the future of senior players Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma following the team's defeat in Sydney.

  • Gambhir refused to comment definitively on the future of Kohli and Sharma, citing their 'hunger' as a deciding factor.
  • He emphasized the need to be fair to all players in the team, regardless of experience.
  • Both players have struggled with form recently, raising questions about their selection for upcoming matches.
  • Rohit Sharma appeared in an interview expressing his commitment to continue playing despite retirement rumors.
  • The selectors face challenges in deciding the future of the veteran players as India prepares for a series in England.
"I can't comment on the future of any Players, it is up to them. They have the hunger and commitment - hopefully they can do everything they can to take Indian cricket forward." - Gautam Gambhir

The upcoming selections for India's Test squad will significantly impact the team's future dynamics, especially concerning seasoned players like Kohli and Sharma.
newTitle: Gautam Gambhir Discusses Future of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma

title: Jasprit Bumrah misses Australia second innings with back injury - ICC Cricket
How invincible Jasprit Bumrah was let down by colossal batting failures and dubious selections - The Indian Express
summary:
India lose BGT: How superhuman Jasprit Bumrah was let down by colossal batting failures and dubious selections

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 Source: Indian Express

India suffered a 1-3 defeat against Australia in the Border Gavaskar Trophy, mainly due to inconsistent batting performances while Jasprit Bumrah's bowling was exceptional, ending the series with 32 wickets.

  • Bumrah's remarkable performance was overshadowed by India's poor batting average of 24.67 compared to Australia's 28.79.
  • India's batting failures included lack of significant contributions from key players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal stood out as India's best batter with 391 runs.
  • Questions were raised over team selection, particularly the choice of spinners on a green pitch.
  • Australia made fewer errors, clinching the trophy they sought after eight years.
“It is just a different ball game, a different planet, that Bumrah is playing on compared to everyone else.” - Adam Gilchrist

The series highlighted the need for improvements in India's batting consistency and tactical decisions moving forward.
newTitle: India loses Border Gavaskar Trophy due to batting failures despite Bumrah's heroics

summary:
Virat Kohli Responds to SCG Crowd Over Sandpaper Gesture

Published on: January 5, 2025 | Source: cricket.com.au

During a match at the Sydney Cricket Ground, Virat Kohli made a gesture to the crowd indicating that he had no sandpaper on him, referencing a past incident involving Australian players.

  • Kohli gestured to the crowd as Australia resumed their innings in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • He turned his pockets inside out and stretched his waistband to show he had nothing, contrasting Cameron Bancroft's hiding of sandpaper.
  • The sandpaper incident occurred in 2018 during a match against South Africa.
  • Kohli previously received the ICC Spirit of Cricket award for defending Steve Smith from booing in 2019.
“I don’t think a guy who is coming out of a situation like that needs to be taken advantage of.” - Virat Kohli

This incident highlights Kohli's ongoing engagement with fans and his stance on sportsmanship.
newTitle: Virat Kohli Responds to SCG Crowd Over Sandpaper Gesture

title: Yashasvi Jaiswal stunner puts Steve Smith's massive milestone on hold - WATCH - The Times of India
summary:
Yashasvi Jaiswal stunner puts Steve Smith's massive milestone on hold - WATCH

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Australia's star batter Steve Smith will have to wait another day to reach the coveted 10,000-run milestone in Test cricket, as he fell for just four runs in the second innings of the fifth Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

  • Steve Smith needed just five runs to become the 15th player in history to reach 10,000 Test runs.
  • He was dismissed for four runs by India's pacer Prasidh Krishna, misjudging a short delivery.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal completed a stunning low catch to dismiss Smith.
  • Earlier, India resumed their innings at 141/6 but added only 16 runs before being bowled out for 157.
  • Scott Boland starred with figures of 6-45.
  • India's Jasprit Bumrah, despite battling back spasms, is set to finish as the leading wicket-taker in the series.
“Smith, needing just five runs to become the 15th player in history to reach 10,000 Test runs, was dismissed for four runs.”

This match marks a key moment in the Test series, as Australia looks to reclaim the Border-Gavaskar Trophy for the first time in a decade.
newTitle: Yashasvi Jaiswal stunner puts Steve Smith's massive milestone on hold - WATCH
